body.name: Hamilton Beach Commercial HDC200B Hospitality 1 Cup Pod Coffeemaker, Black
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 8 hrs 42 mins
FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: Simple, one-touch activation with permanent brew basket
Fits standard 1-cup coffee and tea pods. Not compatible with K-cups
Fast brew time - brews an 8 oz. cup in less than 3 minutes
Automatic shutoff after brewing. Power button activates brewing and illuminates “on” ligh
body.description: Enjoy coffee the way you need it - fast and delicious - with the Hamilton Beach Commercial Single-serve Pod Hospitality Coffee Maker. It combines the convenience of a single-cup coffeemaker with the no-mess ease of coffee pods and excellent coffee extraction. Place pod in basket, fill with water, press to start and enjoy. Coffeemaker brews an 8 oz. cup in less than 3 minutes. Permanent brew basket is easy to remove, rinse and insert back in place. Front-loading design minimizes touching to improve sanitation. Individually wrapped pod holders (sold separately) offer a fresh way to make the coffee or tea you prefer every time. Red indicator light illuminates during brew cycle. Coffeemaker shuts off automatically when brew cycle is complete to save energy and provide peace of mind. It also features an efficient 500-watt heater.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Love the single serving pot! Make my own “pod” out of a coffee filter wrapped around the coffee.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Overall A Very Nice Single Serve Coffee Maker
reviews.reviewText: Overall a very nice small single serve coffee maker that brews a very good cup of coffee. I've been using an older residential model for a number of years but it finally stopped working without pounding on the brew button. This one is apparently a "commercial" model which seems to only mean it has a grounded AC plug. Works just as good as the old and appears nearly identical. The only other major difference is my old one had a double pod brew basket and this one only has a single pod basket. I think the coffee is always better with 2 pods for each brew. I just reused my old double basket in this one, which fits perfectly. Apparently the double pod baskets have been discontinued - unfortunately.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Faster than the Microwave!
reviews.reviewText: I discovered it in a hotel room. The room was cold so I used it for hot tea. Loved the speed. The Freshness of it. The convenience of it. Space saver for sure! My daughter ordered one to surprise me when I got home. Now I surprised her with one. If you are not a whole pot of coffee drinker, or you don't want a big machine on your counter, this is your answer! Can be used for tea, any kind of coffee, looking now for hot chocolate that I can use in it. I think the flat pods are so much more biodegradable as well as space savers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use, great for limited space situations ...
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this to use in my guest room for guests who might want a cup of coffee before venturing out for the day. I had used what I think is the exact same model in hotel rooms in the past so I figured it would be sturdy and not overly complicated.It arrives with no user manual, but the instructions are on the lid of the unit itself. I've used it a few times just to check it out -- I purchased the pods for it here on Amazon. I just use my coffee cup to measure the water, add it to the reservoir, add a pod in the tray, and push the button. Takes about 3-4 minutes, and voila! coffee. It's a decent brew -- not as good as fresh ground, but far better than instant.The only thing I found confusing is there's a red light on the front of the unit just under the "start" button that never comes on -- I assume it's supposed to signal either the unit "working" or "finished," but since it never comes on, I have no idea about its purpose. No big deal, really -- it seems to work just fine without it.I'm basically happy with it so far -- it won't get a huge amount of use so I'm hoping it will last awhile. I may purchase another one for my own bedroom so I can make a cup or two while I'm working on stuff.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This small coffee maker is so cuteI have little counter space
reviews.reviewText: I have very little counter space so this is a good fit.. I especislly like that there is no plastic landfill waste like you get with the kurigs. The pads are easy to obtain from Amazon or Walmart and I have liked the coffe I purchased so far. I am glad I bought it. My daughter wants one

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Ok Coffee maker, just don't buy it here...
reviews.reviewText: I manage a hotel that uses this coffee maker in all of our rooms. While the coffee maker is okay, it is far from the best one cup coffee maker on the market. We've had these in our hotel rooms for almost two years now, and they seem to be holding up just fine under normal use.With that said, I'm giving this coffee maker a 1 star rating due to the sellers here on Amazon.I've ordered this product from both US Bulk Distribution, and Beach Overstock/Estate Clearinghouse.Both times, I recieved the package on time (Thanks Amazon!), and both times the box for the coffee maker was correct, stating it was a HDC200B Hamilton Beach Commercial coffee maker.Each time, from both the sellers, the coffee maker inside was a USED coffee maker of a different brand.Both HDC200B boxes contained a noticably used CV1 coffee maker.Both had coffee stains on the bottom metal plate, hard water spots inside the the water holding area, and visibily discolored water tube from the water holding area to the brew basket area.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars just like at the hotel
reviews.reviewText: we saw this in a hotel and loved it. I make my own "pods" and have coffee ready to go right in my and I toss out the pod. Kind of like a poor man's Keurig. It would be good in a camper, too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2009
reviews.reviewText: I bought this so we could make a cup of coffee after dinner rather than make another entire pot. My husband and I like our coffee fairly strong. The first mug I made was like drinking lightly flavored water. I then made a second mug using only 1/2 mug of water. Coffee was still very weak. The HB brewer was very fast and I was excited to use it. Finally, I made a mug with 1/3 cup of water and 1 pod and it was good coffee. However, I see no point in making 1/3 cup of coffee and using one pod for it. Finally, as a last attempt, I tried using 2 pods for a mug and water spewed out all over the place. So, I learned not to use 2 pods at once. When I made a mug the next time, I used one pot and when it was through brewing, I took the pod out and put it in the coffee mug like I would a tea bag. After 3-4 minutes, it was strong enough to drink. I have now packed it up in the box for a future yard sale and bought a Keurig, which is absolutely fantastic.

reviews.reviewTitle: Why make coffee with a plastic pod when you can have this.
reviews.reviewText: Simple fast way to have a cup of coffee, not using a plastic pod! The tea bag like pod should have always been the way we did our one off coffees.
Il est difficile de se procurer des dosettes dans un sac/poche. Le cafe est bon, cafe filtre. Usage très facile pour personnes âgées. Quantité d'eau pour une tasse.
